abstract: The Upshot; nineteen nations in euro currency union face stronger pressures to lift their economies as European Central Bank stretches limits of its power with 60 billion euro monthly bond-buying program; bank's president Mario Draghi says structural change is required; many countries have been reluctant to spend more, preferring to hew to budget austerity.
lead_paragraph: With the European Central Bank now stretched to the limits of its powers, government spending may be a key variable in the prospects for growth.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David Jolly from Frankfurt, Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, and Jenny Anderson, Peter Eavis and Alison Smale from Davos, Switzerland.

snippet: With the European Central Bank now stretched to the limits of its powers, government spending may be a key variable in the prospects for growth.

headline.main: Eurozone Nations Face Stronger Pressures to Lift Economies
headline.print_headline: Pressure to Lift Growth on Each Eurozone Nation
